entry.title: The admiral who defied orders to save a people #shorts

media:group.media:title: The admiral who defied orders to save a people #shorts
media:group.media:description:
In 1915, Admiral Louis Dartige du Fournet took it upon himself to rescue 4,000 Armenians from certain death on Musa Dagh. Over a century later, Armenia honored his legacy by enshiring him among the foreign rescuers of the Armenian people.

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs Zangezur mine seeks $12 from fired strike organizers: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs Zangezur mine seeks $12 from fired strike organizers: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç The Zangezur mine, one of Armenia‚Äôs largest and most profitable companies, is seeking $12 million in damages from former employees who led a strike earlier this year in protest of what they called low wages and harmful working conditions. üìç Only 6% of the estimated 900,000 Armenians who are expected to submit mandatory income declarations have done so thus far, the latest sign that public opposition to the new filing requirements remains strong. üìç A step-by-step guide to Armenia‚Äôs new income declaration system: https://shorturl.at/w83Et

entry.title: Pashinyan uses profanity in latest attack on church leadership

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan uses profanity in latest attack on church leadership
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia talks peace with a visiting U.S. official, but Baku‚Äôs preconditions - particularly the demand for a land corridor - continue to block a final agreement amid renewed border tensions. üìçTurkey and Azerbaijan reassert calls for a land corridor through Armenia‚Äôs Syunik region, framing it as a strategic link for the Turkic world. üìçPashinyan once again targets the Armenian Apostolic Church and its clergy with insults on social media, leading to outrage. üìç‚ÄúIt is time to materialize a Palestine state‚Äù https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DCQMMdn20pk

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs football star Mkhitaryan to play in Champions League final #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Henrikh Mkhitaryan, Armenia‚Äôs biggest football star and Inter Milan‚Äôs midfield juggernaut, will get what could be his last chance to win the UEFA Champions League, the world‚Äôs most prestigious club trophy, tomorrow, as his side faces Paris Saint-Germain in the final.

entry.title: Controversy stalls Armenia‚Äôs new conscription legislation

media:group.media:title: Controversy stalls Armenia‚Äôs new conscription legislation
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs leadership continues discussing a controversial new conscription bill which, if adopted, will allow young men to significantly decrease their service term should they make a substantial payment to the state budget. üìç Armenia is reinforcing its sovereignty and minimizing security risks through the ongoing border delimitation process with Azerbaijan, the country‚Äôs Deputy Prime Minister Mher Grigoryan claimed. üìç Armenia‚Äôs football star Henrikh Mkhitaryan, together with his Italian side Inter Milan, will take on France‚Äôs PSG on Saturday in what may be his last chance to win the world‚Äôs most prestigious club trophy, the Champions League.

entry.title: Why Armenia‚Äôs new army conscription law misses the point

media:group.media:title: Why Armenia‚Äôs new army conscription law misses the point
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian focuses on Armenia‚Äôs conscription reforms, and asks if it‚Äôs the correct approach to solving the military‚Äôs many issues. Hacopian breaks down the key changes to the draft law, including new payment tiers to reduce service time and harsher penalties for those who dodge it. He also addresses the lack of trust between the military and the people it protects, and the government‚Äôs unwillingness to speak honestly about its failures.
